data.name: Network Programming: Fun with Telnet
data.description:
TASK IN SHORT:

Fill in the ```probe()``` method implementing telnet client to get "Secret Code". Client will send ```ping0111``` command (non case sensitive) to the server established on ```"localhost"``` , ```int PORT = 1110``` and receive server response (Parse it appropriately, figure out the response with ```System.out.println()``` intruction for debugging). Return it as a plain ```String```. "Secret Code" is randomly generated each run. Good Luck!

Useful Reading (As we hope to learn something with this Kata):

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/networking/sockets/readingWriting.html

http://www.tutorialspoint.com/java/java_multithreading.htm

http://www.codejava.net/java-core/the-java-language/java-8-lambda-runnable-example (simplification of the above, java 8 feature)

Hint: Information presented on those single pages should be sufficent to complete the task.
